etymology.description: Phonetic: 來(來) (lái, 'wheat') + Semantic: 子(子) (zǐ, 'child') -> 木(木) (mù, 'tree') emerged corrupting 来 -> 李(李, 'plum tree')
etymology.interpretation: Originally, 李(李) combined 來(來) and 子(子) to form the character. Over time, the phonetic component resembled 木(木), giving 李 its association with 'plum tree,' and evolving into a common surname.

examples.chinese: 李姓在中国很常见(李姓在中國很常見)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐ xìng zài Zhōngguó hěn chángjiàn.
examples.english: The surname Li is very common in China.

examples.chinese: 我在学校认识了李老师(我在學校認識了李老師)，她非常慈祥(她非常慈祥)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài xuéxiào rènshi le Lǐ lǎoshī, tā fēicháng cíxiáng.
examples.english: I met Teacher Li at school, and she is very kind.
